title: Cumin-spiced salmon with lentil & spinach pilaf

instructions.step: Warm 1 tbsp oil in a large frying or saucepan over a medium heat. Add the onions and a pinch of salt, cover and fry for 5 minutes, then fry for another 10 minutes uncovered until golden. Stir in the cinnamon and allspice and cook for another 2 minutes, then stir in the rice, lentils and 3 tbsp water. Stir gently until piping hot. Take off the heat and fold through the spinach until wilted.

Meanwhile, preheat the grill to high. Arrange the salmon fillets on a foil-lined baking tray and brush the tops with the remaining ½ tbsp oil. Sprinkle with the cumin, season and grill for 10 minutes so the fish is cooked through, opaque and will flake easily with a fork.
Divide the pilaf between4 plates. Top with the roughly flaked salmon and pomegranate seeds. Serve with spoonfuls of yogurt.
